entry.title: Skyline Baptist Church
entry.summary:
Visit Skyline Baptist Church

Skyline Baptist Church is a medium-sized Baptist church located in North Bend, Oregon (in the Coos Bay area). Skyline asked me to create a responsive, attractive website based on Wordpress.

The new website is responsive and will adapt to the screen size of any device used to view the site; and the Wordpress backend allows the church staff to maintain and update content on the site, including an advanced calendar and sermon podcasting system.

The Wordpress theme is custom-coded (as are all my themes) and is search engine-friendly.

This was a fun project to build for a great client. Church websites are tricky to get right - there are many needs and a content strategy is key. I'm happy with how this one turned out!

entry.title: Bethany Baptist Church
entry.summary:
Visit Bethany Baptist Church

As a member of Bethany Baptist Church in Salem, Oregon, I was excited to have a chance to redesign their website. Bethany Baptist is a medium-sized church located in south Salem. The website is built with a custom-designed Wordpress theme. It uses responsive design, meaning the site layout will adapt to various mobile devices with different screen sizes. "Pinch to zoom" not required!

The site uses advanced CSS/Javascript menus that are touchscreen-friendly, customized Wordpress plugins for the events calendar and other functions, and a search engine-friendly Wordpress template.

entry.title: Oregon Travel Experience
entry.summary:
Visit Oregon Travel Experience

I did not design the website for Oregon Travel Experience. Instead, OTE already had a complete design provided to them. I planned and created a complete Wordpress theme and custom coding to implement the design into a working website.

Oregon Travel Experience is a semi-independent state agency that manages travel-related services throughout Oregon. OTE administers the Heritage Tree and Historical Marker programs as well as providing the blue highway signs with business logos. They provide many other services around the state as well.

OTE was previously known as the Oregon Travel Information Council but went through an extensive rebranding process which included the new logo and website design. The OTIC still exists as the administrative body for OTE.

This website features a jQuery slider on the home page, a customized mapping plugin, and a design that reflows to fit smartphone screens, eliminating "Pinch to zoom".

entry.title: YWCA - Salem, Oregon
entry.summary:
Visit YWCA - Salem, Oregon

The Salem, Oregon affiliate of the YWCA approached Opt-e-Web for a new website design last winter. I designed and developed this site as Design Director for Opt-e-Web.

The design carefully follows national YWCA branding guidelines. The new website highlights the programs and services provided by the YWCA and is easily editable by the client through Wordpress.
